UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Small, shiny disc made pass at Air Force plane
Two disc-shaped UFOs approached close to B-36 bomber, also seen from ground
Air Force bomber tracked "mother ship," smaller high-speed objects, on radar
Luminous object descended, hovered in front of airliner, then sped away at upward angle
Villas Boas abduction, sexual encounter case
Air Force officer's car failed, he saw disc-shaped objects on ground
Disc with dome illuminated area in green light, two beings visible in dome
State Police encounter with highly maneuverable elliptical object, red light beams swept ground
Barney and Betty Hill vehicle encounter, abduction case
Whitish elliptical object with legs seen on ground by police officer, left imprints and scorched foliage when it took off
Farmer found shiny elliptical object in field, confronted by two small humanoids who spoke with him
Glowing oval object landed, indentations and scorch marks found at site
Object landed in field, physical traces
Domed disc rose from woods, electromagnetic (E-M) effects on van, 10-meter (30-foot) burnt circle found next day
Rectangular object with legs left flattened wheat and three indentations on the edge of a circle
Brilliantly lit top-shaped object made head-on passes at car, paced ahead of it, hovering and darting motions
NICAP report, The UFO Evidence, released to Congress and news media.
Humanoid with dark suit and helmet, climbed on top of craft. Physical traces found at site
Pilot observed formation of four white lights joined by two others, paced aircraft for five minutes
Aluminum-colored sphere with luminous ring hovered for four to five minutes. Air Force unidentified case
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Blinking red light approached air base runway, hovered, reversed direction. Air Force unidentified case
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
A bow-and-arrow hunter separated from his companions was treed by humanoid and robot-like beings after a UFO was observed descending
Engineer, others, observed dome-shaped object following jet fighters. UFO shot straight up and out of sight
Two objects landed on hilltop, large group of humanoid beings engaged in apparent repair operation for four hours
Cone-shaped object crossed highway, car engine failed, object landed. Radioactive area found at landing site
sighting concentration around Washington, DC, which led to CIA contact with NICAP to obtain information.
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Aerospace engineer watched round glowing object move rapidly from horizon to nearly overhead
Army Signal Corps communications system specialists observed 12-15 white ovals maneuvering erratically, with jets seen in pursuit
Border Patrol officer saw bright disc illuminating ground, swoop down, hover near car, accelerate up into clouds with rushing air sound
Humanoid beings emerged from landed object at archery range, approached witness, who froze, apparently paralyzed
Metallic-appearing, mushroom-shaped object, red-orange glow, at low level. Sound like vacuum cleaner heard, E-M effects on car
NASA engineer saw V-shaped object with red-orange lights zigzagging at low level. Object touched down briefly, took off, rapidly climbed out of sight
Flying Tiger aircrew observed three red oval objects, tracked on airborne radar. Paced aircraft for 30 minutes, departed upward at high speed
Hovering cone-shaped object, animal reaction. Witness struck on forehead by light beam, unconscious, eye damage. Damaged foliage found at site
USAF weather observer saw black oval with body lights flying in and out of clouds
Circular UFO with three legs on or near the ground, trees illuminated. Departed rapidly with buzzing sound. Circular ring impression found at site
Elliptical object paced airliner, accelerated and sped away, photographs taken
Elliptical object with legs observed on ground, two small humanoids pointed pencil-like device at witness, paralyzing him. Strong physical trace evidence at site
Meteorological observers at scientific research bases watched zigzagging and maneuvering objects, including a lens-shaped disc. E-M effects
Police lieutenant and officer saw hovering white object that undulated, darted here and there, zigzagged, and sped away
Domed disc with legs on beach, dogs barked loudly. Object took off with sound of rushing air, yellow-orange glow from underside
Domed object paced car, climbed out of sight
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Summer 1965 sighting wave mostly in Southwestern U.S. and northward through the central tier of states, later in eastern U.S. (See separate chronology, section VIII.)

Denver Post editorial: "Maybe it's time for more people to get serious about the UFO question. . . . If we still choose to be skeptical, we nevertheless are not nearly so ready as we once were to dismiss all reports of variously shaped but elusive flying objects as products of midsummer night dreams."

Highway investigator Rex Heflin, three Polaroid photos of domed-disc UFO (section VII). August 4, 1965. Fort Worth Star Telegram (TX) editorial: "They can stop kidding us now about there being no such thing as 'flying saucers. . . .' Too many people of obviously sound mind saw and reported them independently. . . . Their descriptions of what they saw were too similar to one another, and too unlike any familiar object. . . ."
E-M effects on truck, domed disc swooped overhead, hovered just above road, blocked highway
U.S. Air Force and Royal Canadian Air Force radar tracked formations of 7-10 UFOs over Lake Superior and Duluth, MN, moving at about 9,000 mph, altitudes between 5,200 and 17,000 feet

Cascade (ID) News editorial: "An objective observer is about forced to the conclusion that there are objects of some sort appearing in the skies that cannot be explained by any conventional circumstances. There is absolutely no reason to deny the UFOs' existence because we don't understand them."
Boeing aerospace engineer saw two silvery, disc-shaped objects that hovered for several minutes, departed upward at high speed one after the other
9:40 P.M. Fireball meteor traveling easterly across northeast sky.
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Portsmouth (NH) Herald editorial: "Perhaps we really do have visitors from somewhere beyond our present ken."

Christian Science Monitor editorial: "[UFOs] sighted early this month over Texas may give scientists something to think about for a long time. . . . They give the clearest evidence of all that something strange actually was in the sky. . . . It makes the clearest case yet for a thorough look at the saucer mystery."
E-M effects in barn, elliptical object landed nearby, animals reacted, beeping sound. Object shot straight up into clouds. Physical traces at site
Science editor, Christian Science Monitor: "Flying saucers are all but literally knocking on the laboratory door. . . . Something definitely is going on that cannot yet be explained."
Citizen reports of glowing red, elliptical object at low level, verified by police, row of bright pulsating red lights, animal reactions
Two sheriffs saw huge, brightly illuminated object speed toward their patrol car, hover, illuminate them and the terrain in purple light. Heat felt
Domed disc descended, humming sound, blue light. Motorbike engine failed, witness paralyzed, shock, static electricity
Constables in police van encountered domed disc on highway, object lifted off emitting flame. Tar and gravel road severely damaged
At 5:15 P.M., scientist saw metallic-appearing, cigar-shaped object that changed course
Fireball meteor sighting at 7:56 P.M. American Meteor Society No. 2389.

Memo from Maj. Gen. E. B. LeBailly, USAF director of information, to USAF Scientific Advisory Board requesting a scientific panel to review the methods and findings of Project Blue Book. LeBailly noted: "Many of the reports that cannot be explained have come from intelligent and technically well-qualified individuals whose integrity cannot be doubted."
Radar-visual sighting of 12 UFOs, jet interceptor pursuit
Massive power blackout in northeastern United States at about 5:25 P.M. (EST). Some reports of UFOs coincided, with resulting speculation about a possible relationship
Domed disc, E-M effects on engine and headlights, truck spun off road into ditch. Object ascended with whistling sound, sparks from underside
USAF Scientific Advisory Board met to review Project Blue Book. Issued report dated "March 1966" recommending contracts to universities to study selected UFO sightings.
Brightly lighted disc with legs seen landing and taking off again. Imprints and scorch marks found at site
Glowing orange object with domed top hovered, maneuvered over area, seen by police and citizens. Tracked on Air Force and Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) radar
NICAP contacted by United Nations Secretary General U Thant's office requesting information and documents on UFOs.
Midwestern and northeastern U.S. sighting wave (see separate chronology, section VIII).

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: Dexter, Milan, and Ann Arbor, MI
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Sheriffs reported disc-shaped objects moving at fantastic speeds and making sharp turns, diving and climbing, hovering. Selfridge AFB confirmed tracking UFOs over Lake Erie
Egg-shaped object with flashing lights across the center (red-white-blue-green-red) hovered over power lines, bobbed around, and rocked in a pendulum motion
Officials, college students saw UFO settle in a hollow, emitting orange, red, and white lights
Huge, elongated craft blocking high-way, flashing body lights, port, door, antenna on top, spindly legs. Human-like figure entered, craft took off, hovered, sped away
Control tower personnel, police. Radar-visual sighting of maneuvering object
Rep. Gerald Ford (R-Mich.) issued call for UFO hearings.
NICAP press conference at National Press Club.

The Christian Science Monitor editorialized that the Michigan sightings had "deepened the mystery" and "it is time for the scientific community to conduct a thorough and objective study of the 'unexplainable.'"
Luminous object hovered, blocked roadway, bobbed up and down, moved quickly. Car buffeted, humming sound. Object rose, sped off at steep angle

Editorial, Indianapolis (IN) News: "What is needed, obviously, is more public inquiry conducted under scrupulously objective auspices. . . . Too many people have seen too many things for the subject to be dismissed with mere off-hand explanations."

House Armed Services Committee hearing on UFOs in U.S. Congress. Only Air Force witnesses called to testify. Hearings used as forum to announce that new independent scientific study would be undertaken.
Sheriffs confronted by glowing object, light beam illuminated road, humming sound. Chased UFO across state line, other police witnesses en route. Object shot straight up out of sight
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).
Rep. Gerald Ford (R-Mich.) issued news release announcing that USAF was arranging for a "study of UFOs by topflight scientists not connected in any way with the Air Force."
Gallup Poll reported 96 percent public awareness of UFOs, and that nearly half of the adult population believed UFOs were real.
CBS Reports "Flying Saucers: Friend, Foe or Fantasy?" presented extremely negative Air Force and "scientific" views, primarily those of Dr. Donald Menzel and Dr. Carl Sagan, both skeptics.
Experienced pilot in light plane encountered disc with dome that made sharp turn, passed beneath his wing
Brilliantly lighted object illuminated terrain at Army base, widespread E-M effects on vehicles and machinery. Object shot straight up out of sight within seconds
Elliptical object with body lights, surrounded by mist or vapor, observed by police officer, led him on cat-and-mouse chase. Object accelerated and sped away
Six FAA personnel observed oval UFOs, radar-visual sighting. One object accelerated rapidly

Robert J. Low, later coordinator of the Colorado UFO project, sent a memo to University of Colorado officials suggesting how they could deal with scientific disdain of UFO sightings. "The trick would be" to make it "appear a totally objective study"
"Plasma Theory May Explain Many UFOs," by Philip J. Klass, Aviation Week.

Dr. J. A. Hynek released to the press a letter rejected by Science magazine reporting a "pattern" to UFO sightings that "suggests that something is going on" and disputing seven misconceptions about UFOs. Science had a belated change of heart and published the letter on October 21, with the headline, "UFOs Merit Scientific Study."
Local concentration peaking in late 1966 and 1967
"The Disputed CIA Documents on UFOs," by John Lear in Saturday Review discusses oddities about the January 1953 Robertson Panel report before it was declassified.
Air Force Regulation (AFR) 80-17 promulgated to replace AFR 200-2, placing UFOs under the Research and Development command and reflecting the University of Colorado Project study in progress.
Private pilot encountered coneshaped object, "singing" noise. Object descended, followed aircraft, accelerated up and away
Hovering object with smaller satellite objects operating independently, emitted light beams, finally sped away
"Many UFOs Are Identified as Plasmas," by Philip J. Klass in Aviation Week.
USAF public announcement of grant to University of Colorado for a UFO study to be headed by Dr. E. U. Condon.
Project Sign ("Saucer") report of February 1949 declassified from its formerly SECRET status.
Red-orange disc-shaped object followed car, ground brightly illuminated, engine, headlights failed. Physiological effects
Official contract starting date of Colorado UFO Project.
"Are Flying Saucers Real?" by Dr. J. A. Hynek in Saturday Evening Post, stating that hundreds of puzzling UFO cases exist and urging a serious inquiry
Two luminous objects paced Canadian Pacific Airlines plane at 35,000 feet for seven minutes, emitted light beams up, then down, accelerated away
Intensive U.S. and international UFO sighting wave (see separate chronology, section VIII).
Dome-shaped object hovered over car, roadway brightly illuminated. Forward motion slowed, unable to accelerate, loss of steering control
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Approximately 4:30-6:30 A.M. Sodium vapor clouds from rocket launched at Eglin AFB, FL, blue-green color, visible over wide area.

Dr. E. U. Condon, scientific director of the Colorado UFO Project, spoke to the Corning, NY, section of the American Chemical Society, stating that the government should get out of the UFO business, since there was apparently nothing to it.
Betty Andreasson abduction
Airliner buzzed by maneuvering coneshaped object, took position above tail. Lights in plane dimmed, radio interference, radio compass oscillated
Domed disc with revolving lights at bottom edge flew over car just above phone lines. Later at treetop level, stopped, banked, and took off
Disc-shaped object in field, small beings moved around beneath it. Beings disappeared behind shaft, object sped away

and some other countries. 6:30-9:30 P.M. Objects with streams of lights, erratic motions. No USAF unknowns or Colorado Project cases for this date. Suspected extraordinary phenomenon (meteor train?) or military maneuvers.
Radar-visual sightings of three to four silvery discs traveling about 2,000 mph. News blackout invoked by military
Radar tracked object descending over missile sites, security teams saw disc with flashing lights hover about 500 feet off ground. Object departed straight up
Domed circular object with red body lights approached witnesses, gave off burst of brilliant white light, hissing sound, accelerated away
Security guards saw glowing red disc hover near missile site, weapons shut down
Carroll Watts contactee case. Cylindrical craft hovering just above ground, voice communicated with witness
FAA Notice N7230.29 published, establishing procedures for "Reporting of Unidentified Flying Objects" to the Colorado UFO Project.
Jonestown/Lickdale, PA. Disc passed over car, gave off sparks, car rocked, engine failed, humming sound heard. Sulphur-like smell. Physiological effects
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).

American Society of Newspaper Editors sponsors panel discussion on UFOs at its annual meeting in Washington, DC. Panelists included Dr. James E. McDonald, Dr. Donald Menzel, and Maj. Hector Quintanilla.
Eta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Witness approached landed object, violet light, rushing air sound, voices heard. Experienced severe burns on chest, weight loss, and vomiting
Two Spanish Air Force fighter pilots chased UFO, radios failed. Cat and mouse pursuit. Object shot straight up and disappeared

Dr. James E. McDonald, University of Arizona atmospheric physicist, gave a presentation on UFOs to the Outer Space Affairs Group of the United Nations. Secretary General U Thant expressed deep concern over UFO situation.
Silvery cylinder seen for several minutes, chased by two F-102 interceptors
Intensive U.S. and international sighting wave. (See separate chronology, Section VIII.)
Round, blue-white object hovered near missile site, animals reacted. Object started, stopped, moved up and down. changed color to red when accelerating
Oval object approached fire lookout tower, hovered, illuminated ground
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Saturn-shaped object with rotating ring emerged from sea, hovered, ascended slowly, accelerated into sky and out of sight
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Huge disc on or just above ground in field, three small humanoid beings emerged, apparently gathered specimens. Physical traces
Two humanoid beings in silvery suits, round helmets, emerged from disc with dome
Campers saw glowing oval that beamed light down, engulfed canoe. Memory loss and abduction. (See section XIII bibliography, Fowler, 1990a.)
Hundreds of sightings in wave that peaked in October. House of Commons took interest in November.
Cone-shaped object, haze or mist around lower portion, approached airliner from west, passed under starboard wing, turning and maneuvering
Geology professor watched flight of two silvery cigar-shaped objects
Aircraft engineer sighted disc-shaped object with windows, blinking lights, light beam illuminating ground
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
UFO with windows approached, tilted down. Two humanoid figures and control panels visible. Object tilted back up, shot out of sight in seconds
Sphere rose, paced car, which began steering hard. Object hovered near missile base, shot straight up out of sight in seconds
Domed disc, lights along rim, two beings visible in clear dome, hovered above car. Car drawn into adjacent field, witnesses confronted by beings
Officer Herbert Schirmer vehicle encounter and abduction case
Bright illumination from domed disc, object tipped forward, two humanoid figures visible inside. Object rotated, moved away
Geminid meteor shower (mean date).
Round orange-red object hovered near ground, moved abruptly to position behind car, road illuminated. Made repeated passes at car
Barking dogs, unusual sound, attracted attention to round object with ports, flames from underside. Object moved jerkily, rising and falling, hovered briefly, sped away
Dr. David Saunders and Dr. Norman Levine, members of Air Force-sponsored Colorado UFO project, fired by Dr. E. U. Condon for alleged "incompetence" in controversy over project management
Luminous elliptical object followed car for 30 minutes, moved back and forth across road, made sharp turns and unusual maneuvers, suddenly disappeared
Witness felt "tingling sensations", domed disc with ports maneuvered around farm, emitting high-pitched whine. Dog cowered in snow, tattle bolted

About 9:50 P.M. (CST). Hundreds of people reported fiery objects streaking across the sky, some showering sparks, leaving bright trails. Zond IV Soviet satellite reentry and decay (Sagan and Page, 1972, 155-161).
LOOK article, "Flying Saucer Fiasco" by John Fuller, reporting internal controversy in the Colorado UFO Project and the Low "trick" memo.
"UFO Project: Trouble on the Ground" by Philip M. Boffey in Science magazine, reporting on the internal problems of the Colorado UFO Project.
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).

House Science and Astronautics Committee symposium on UFOs chaired by Rep. Edward Roush (D-Ind.). Witnesses included Robert M. Baker, Robert L. Hall, James A. Harder, J. Allen Hynek, James E. McDonald, and Carl Sagan.
Dome-shaped object hovered low over ground, grayish light beam cast sharp shadows. Humming sound, dogs reacted strongly
Dual abduction of male and female summer camp staff members. Independent recall of event years later
Round silver object flew overhead, reversed direction, three photos taken. Object finally shot upward out of sight
Luminous white UFO emitted six smaller "satellite objects"
Colorado UFO Project final report submitted to secretary of the Air Force for review by the National Academy of Sciences.
Flurry of sightings primarily in the southeastern and northwestern United States.
Domed disc descended, flew over shrimp boat. Hovered briefly, shone light down on boat, then took off straight up out of sight
Oval object beamed light down on car, electrical system failed. After it departed rapidly straight up, electrical system resumed functioning
Pilots saw two luminous objects join up, hover about 10 seconds, then speed out of sight in seconds. Confirmed by Air Force radar
Four bright, oval objects paced aircraft. Pilot turned plane toward them, objects formed vertical stack, shot up and out of sight
Round object with body lights hovered, shone red light beam to ground. When officer shone flashlight at object, it immediately blacked out
Top-shaped object paced car, sped away

National Academy of Sciences letter by Dr. Frederick Seitz, president, to secretary of the Air Force, stating that the NAS review panel "unanimously approved" the Colorado University (Condon Committee) report.
University of Colorado "Condon Report" publicly released.

Press conference at National Press Club. Donald Keyhoe, NICAP director, Richard Hall, N1CAP assistant director, Dr. James E. McDonald, and Dr. David R. Saunders disputing conclusions of the Condon Report.

Roscoe Drummond, syndicated columnist, in Christian Science Monitor (response to University of Colorado report): "I find it hard to escape the conclusion that there are too many unexplained and presently unexplainable unidentified flying objects from too many credible and responsible witnesses to banish the subject from public concern."
Object emitting blinding light beam paced ahead of vehicle, heat felt. Light beam associated with E-M effects. Object rose and fell, veered off, flew out of sight
Light beam shone on road ahead of car, dog reacted. Witness drove beneath domed disc, car motion slowed. Eye irritation
Disc with dome passed overhead, stopped, emitted light beam onto road, illuminating police chief's car. Finally ascended, flew away to south
Flight surgeon, crew of KC-135, observed huge black cylinder hovering, inclined in vertical position. Fighter aircraft sent to investigate, object disappeared

"The Condon Report and UFOs" by Dr. J. Allen Hynek, Bulletin of the Atomic Scientists, called the report: "a strange sort of scientific paper [that] does not fulfill the promise of its title. . . [It] leaves the same strange, inexplicable residue Of unknowns which has plagued the U.S. Air Force investigation for 20 years."
7:38 P.M. Bright fireball meteor traveling south-southeast to north-northwest, leaving long trail, sparks.
E-M effects on car, static electricity. Bluish object shaped like inverted mushroom hovered overhead. Took off at high speed
Circular object with lights hovering over airport sped away making high, whining sound when security guard shone spotlight on it
Secretary of the Air Force Robert C. Seamans, Jr., announced termination of Project Blue Book UFO study.

American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS) annual meeting, in Boston, MA, included panel discussion on UFOs. Scientists joined in statement asking for preservation of Air Force UFO files for future study.
Hospital nurse saw craftlike object hovering near building, two humanoid figures visible in upper portion
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Two skiers saw disc-shaped object approach, hover, humanoid appeared in light beam from object. Memory loss, extensive physiological effects
Daylight disc photo similar to August 3, 1965, Santa Ana, CA, photos
Domed disc on ocean surface, two humanoid figures visible, took off in an arc, headed out to sea
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Egg-shaped object approached police car, engine, lights, and radio failed. Object took off at high speed
Disc with dome descended, hovered over car, driver blinded by strong blue-white light, physiological effects. Object departed rapidly straight up
The UFO Subcommittee of the American Institute for Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) published its report, UFO, An Appraisal of the Problem, recommending continued investigation of UFO sightings.
Close-range sighting of disc with windows, two humanoid figures visible inside, light beam upward from top
Saturn-shaped object darted around, rocked back and forth while hovering, rapid acceleration upward at angle
U.S. KH-9 "Big Bird" spy satellite incinerated on reentry into atmosphere.
Airline flight paced for 20 minutes by glowing orange disc ("like two round basins, one on top of the other")
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Aerial survey plane photo showing disc on edge
Soviet Salyut 1 space station burned up during atmospheric reentry.
Brilliantly lighted, mushroomshaped object hovered just off ground, sheep reacted, light beam, landing traces, physiological effects
Motorist experienced engine failure, pulsating yellow oval object visible on road ahead. Object illuminated trees as it departed
Luminous object beamed light at car, engine lost power
Bright daylight fireball meteor filmed lasting up to 45 seconds or more.
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Elliptical object with bright lights hovered near ground emitting light beams downward, satellite objects emerged. UFO reacted to flashlight
Luminous, bowl-shaped object hovered near ground. Blinding white light brightly illuminated terrain. Object made "whooshing" noise, shot straight up

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: Between Bedoga Bay and Woodland, CA
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Judy Kendall abduction, three types of beings
Intense blue-white light paced airliner for 20-25 seconds, navigation instruments malfunctioned
Youths photographed disc-shaped object, analysis supported authenticity
Disc with dome maneuvered around DC-8 aircraft, confirmed by airborne radar. Shadowy figures seen in dome
At least 16 sightings of round or egg-shaped objects
Domed disc with ports and legs hovered in a grove of trees, physical traces found
Mobile home park UFO landing, sound, E-M, animal reactions, light beams, bright illumination, physical traces
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).

Flurry of sightings in Georgia, Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Ohio. Fast-moving oblong objects with bright flashing or revolving lights witnessed by local and state police. (See separate chronology, section VIII.)
Elliptical object with dome hovered about 10 feet off ground, swaying back and forth. Humanoid being appeared, reptered craft when observed
Charles Hickson and Charles Parker abduction case
Sheriffs saw and chased pulsating orange objects that alternately hovered, swinging like pendulum, darted around at high speed
Pulsating object photographed during sighting wave
Army Reserve helicopter encountered domed, craftlike object that beamed green light into cockpit, lifted helicopter off course
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Numerous reported landings, humanoids, and E-M effects on cars in province
Top-shaped object with windows moved with "incredible speed," darted behind jet interceptor, shot straight up in sky
Gallup Poll showed that 51 percent of Americans believe UFOs are "real," 11 percent claim personal sightings, and 93 percent are aware of the subject.
UFO hovered and darted around near CaseIle Airport, seen by pilots and tracked on airport radar
Egg-shaped object with body lights sped toward witnesses, hovered. Reacted to light signals, sped off to south, departed upward at steep angle
UFO landed, humanoid encounter
V-formation of luminous orange discs observed by airline crew
Round orange object paced, approached truck, E-M effects on lights and engine, truck lifted off road, steering control lost, feeling of vacuum
Luminous saucer-shaped object with colored rings ahead of plane confirmed by Milan radar, chased by pilot

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: En route San Juan, Puerto Rico, to Cordoba, Argentina
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Argentine Airlines plane flanked by two glowing objects that paced it for several minutes, then sped away
TWA airliner crew observed shiny oval or cigar-shaped object, five smaller spherical-appearing satellite objects
Concentration of UFO sightings, including vehicle encounters
Blinding light from hovering object, car engine quit, lights went out. Object flew away with whistling sound, car then functioned normally
Disc with dome descended, three beings visible inside transparent dome
Elliptical object with body lights hovered low, moved toward police car. Officer turned spotlight on it, brilliant white beam from object illuminated patrol car
Five dome-shaped objects in pasture, spinning and swirling grass. Objects took off, aligned in formation, climbed into clouds
Dogs barked furiously, circular yellow-white object emitted two light beams to ground, illuminated terrain brightly
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Carl Higdon abduction
Abduction case
Dome-shaped object observed on ground by guard at Air Force base. Body lights visible, ground illuminated as object took off
Photo of Saturn-shaped object with squarish ring, similar to July 7, 1989, case
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Three humanoid beings in protective gear emerged from domed disc, witness injured, paralyzed, by flash of light
Sheriff, county and state officials observed bright, round object hovering near missile base. Object made rapid darting movements, bobbed up and down
Intensely bright domed disc, orange glow, emitted conical light beam down on lake, illuminated terrain, sped away at "colossal speed"
Project Blue Book files transferred from Maxwell AFB, Alabama, to Natignal Archives in Washington, DC.
Concentration of sightings of Vshaped objects, hover-acceleration, bright illumination
Disc-shaped object with dome, light beam, made right-angle turn, approached, hovered. Began to oscillate, shot straight up out of sight in seconds
Three domed discs paced small aircraft, one off each wing and one behind, confirmed by radar. E-M effects on radio, aircraft lifted
Saturn-shaped UFO, E-M effects on truck, two humanoids visible through transparent dome
Eta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Concentration of sightings
Photos of Saturn-shaped object, very similar to Hamazaki videotape of July 6-7, 1989
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Oval object, occupants visible; light struck witness in face, nose bleed and vomiting. Physical traces at site
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Sgt. Charles L. Moody abduction case
Pilots and air traffic controllers at airport observed red-orange disc, gray mist formed, object shot out of sight
Gray, disc-shaped UFO, bright illumination, darted above car, hovered, cast pulsating light beam down on it. Physiological effects
Domed disc hovered, illuminated area "like daylight," cows fled. Emitted bright red light, humming sound, took off at high speed
Large object with green flashing lights passed over truck from behind, hovered ahead, lights and engine failed, light beam directed toward truck
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
October 28, 1975; Objects with body lights penetrated security areas on two consecutive nights, hovered near weapons storage area, tracked on radar
Security police and others watched objects breach security areas, hover low over weapons storage area
Travis Walton abduction case
Base personnel saw orange disc that breached security area, illuminated missile site, tracked on radar
Civilians, police officers, military officers, and NORAD radar saw and tracked UFOs that alternately hovered and darted around at high speed
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Domed disc with body lights descended, illuminated car interior with blue light. Missing time, abduction, physiological effects
Dome-shaped object hovered above road, E-M effects on car. Missing time, abduction
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Low-hovering disc with dome, rotating rim and bright lights, power failure. Object moved away, shone beams of light down
F-4 fighter aircraft attempted intercept of radar-visual UFO, E-M system failures, physiological effects
Sir Eric Gairy, Prime Minister of Grenada, addressed the UN General Assembly urging recognition of UFOs as a serious international scientific problem.
Control tower and airline pilot on runway observed glowing disc like "two plates placed together" hovering to south. Object then flew away.
Miniwave of UFO sightings, including round and triangular objects
Boat brightly illuminated by round glowing object, abnormal silence, heat, boat held back as if by invisible force, light beam, time loss
Brilliant white light zigzagging erratically at high speed, confirmed on ground and airborne radar. Responded to pilot flashing his landing lights.
Disc hovered, illuminated barnyard, farm animals reacted, watchdog later died. Witness felt electric shock, heat, paralysis. Physiological and physical effects.
Humanoid encounter
Radar-visual UFO approached Mirage bomber, sped away
Brightly lighted ellipse hovered, car engine failed, lights dimmed. Pressure, tingling sensation felt, physiological effects
Groupe d'Etude des Phenomenes Aerospatiaux Non-Identifies (GEPAN) organized under the auspices of the French national space agency for the study of UFOs.
Luminous round object with dome hovered above a NATO base security zone, spinning. Changed color, emitted sound like swarm of bees
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Orange-red objects hovered nearby, car lost power
Object with row of "windows" overtook airliner, accelerated, made 90-degree turn, soared upward out of sight
Three objects like aircraft tracked on FAA radar in V-formation at almost 17,000 mph
Red sphere ahead of airplane, navigation instruments and radio E-M effects. UFO changed color to white, climbed vertically at high speed
Hovering dome-shaped object sped toward witness, stopped, beamed blue light onto dead tree, which fluoresced in bright colors. Sheep fled
Four UFOs tracked on radar; bright, circular objects maneuvered around airliner
Geminid meteor shower (mean date).
Two UFOs tracked on radar giving "strong" returns, at speeds in excess of 1,000 mph. One made head-on pass at an aircraft, observed on radar
White disc, red blinking lights top and bottom, paced airliner for 20 minutes. Emitted green "smoke" from underside, sped out of sight
Veteran pilot observed domed disc with portholes
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Humanoid case
Formations of UFOs seen, MP at adjacent Fort Dix shot humanoid being, AF security police found body on deserted runway
American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics held symposium on Space and UFOs in Los Angeles, CA.
Widespread UFO sightings, including formations and disc-shaped objects with windows
William J. Herrmann abduction case
Round object with body lights hovered ahead of car, made pulsating sound. Tilted down, beamed a bright light from the top onto car.
Navy radar tracked an oblong object with body lights, illuminating the terrain, observed by citizens. Object alternately hovered and accelerated
Cessna pilot observed small silvery oval that maneuvered near his plane
Italian, South American, Middle Eastern, and Asian UFO wave. (See separate chronology, section VIII.)
Car levitated, altered environment, memory loss, translocation of vehicle
Several Coast Guard stations observed cigar-shaped object with same pattern of body lights, moving at very high rate of speed
Woman reported brilliantly lighted object buzzed her car, briefly lifted it off road
Rash of UFO sightings reported to police over two days, probably including Delta Aquarid meteors
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Silver dome-shaped object, green glow, hovered overhead, began circling. E-M effects, dogs whined. UFO finally took off at high speed
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Object ahead of airliner, opening appeared, smaller objects emerged, maneuvered around it, reentered and "departed at a tremendous speed."
Car engine and lights failed, domed disc descended onto road. Two small humanoids emerged, examined car, reentered object, took off
Whistling sound, disc-shaped object with dome on mudflat. Small humanoid emerged, made repair to craft, took off with loud explosive sound
Car participating in road rally brightly illuminated by glowing object, lifted off road, driver and passenger blinded, steering control lost
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Cessna pilot Frederick Valentich aerial encounter with elongated object, plane and pilot disappeared
Pilots and air traffic controllers saw shiny objects, one sped away, circled, maneuvered, descended in distance
Technicians observed landing of discshaped object in oil field, E-M effects on oil pumps and communications
Two airliner crews encountered disc with dome, structural features, emitting light beams
Also December 8, 1978. UN committee meetings on UFOs. Speakers included J. Allen Hynek, Jacques Vallee, Stanton Friedman, Lawrence J. Coyne.
Also December 22 and 31, 1978. New Zealand radar-visual and photo cases.
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Dog barked, mother and child saw craft on ground, humanoid encounter
Three glowing, red triangular objects confronted car, forward motion impeded, physiological effects
Brilliant illumination of car, E-M effects. Driver shocked and dazed, memory loss
Dome-shaped object skimmed treetops, moved up and down, illuminated area. Similar object hovered over highway, swept area with light beam
Oil field landing, reaction to light, landing traces
Eta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Private pilot and airline crew saw string of orange objects maneuvering and changing formation, tracked on radar

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: Los Angeles and San Fernando Valley, CA
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Flurries of sightings
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Large, glowing disc with bubblelike dome on top, two humanoid beings visible through transparent dome
Pilot observed two disc-shaped objects below his plane, contour flying "on the deck" through hills and valleys
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Silvery cigar with orange light and square windows approached, hovered, finally sped away over horizon
Disc with flamelike jets around perimeter hovered ahead of car, darted from point to point. Took off at "very high speed"
Object buzzed car, jetlike sound, bright illumination. Dog howled as if his ears hurt
Three smaller objects were observed on airport radar joining a larger, brighter object, then separating again
Car drove into "fog," headlights deflected upwards, driver abducted onto silvery domed object with portholes, examined on metallic table
Red disc-shaped object emitted light beam to ground. Took off with intense humming sound leaving exhaust trail
Five apparently metallic Saturnshaped objects, Iligh-speed flight in formation at low altitude, visible against local terrain
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).
Shiny sphere flying with rapid up and down motions observed through binoculars. Stopped, spinning, over Lick Observatory, accelerated rapidly and sped away
Eta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Disc with dome maneuvered near car, E-M effects on radio
Glowing disc cast light beam onto road. Car entered beam, headlights flickered off and on several times, afterwards worked normally
Young woman and daughter driving home, E-M effects on car, car lifted off road onto craft, humanoids examined them on tables in room with "fog" on floor
Spinning topshaped object with body lights, whistling sound, landed near water tank, vibrations felt, uncomfortable sound, livestock reacted. Physical traces
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Boomerang-shaped object with body lights shone brilliant light beam down smoke stacks, accelerated, made noninertial turn. Satellite objects
Leonid meteor shower (mean date).
Light beamed onto car, lights and radio failed, car levitated on board domed craft surrounded by dense cloud or mist, couple examined. Car placed back on road
Official Chinese news agency Xinhua reported that an association to study UFOs had been established in Peking.
Constable Alan Godfrey encountered craft on road, time loss. Abduction scenario emerged under hypnosis
Radar-visual sighting of four objects at airport
Air Force security police encounter with landed craft in Rendlesham Forest, physical evidence
Diamond- or spindle-shaped object blocked vehicle. Heat, sound, strong physiological effects indicating radioactivity. Mystery helicopters followed UFO
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
Four silvery discs executed turns, maneuvers, in a diamond formation. Objects flashed in sunlight as they turned, crossed western sky
Landing, physical trace case investigated by official French agency
Local concentration of sightings
Hovering cigar- or spindle-shaped object, disc with dome, darting motions, numerous photographs taken
Red-lighted object made pass at aircraft, instant relocation. "Very tight turns," hovered, accelerated away at "extremely high rate of speed."
Two-foot diameter aluminum-like disc hovered a few feet off road about 40 feet away. Climbed rapidly through sky and disappeared in distance
Small, shiny object below private plane. Object fluttered or tilted, accelerated rapidly, sped away
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).
Disc with dome hovered over truck, forward motion impeded, truck lifted off road
Major airline L-1011 jumbo jet en route from San Francisco to New York City encountered silvery disc-shaped object
Brightly lighted, dome-shaped object with windows approached, turned, followed car, bright illumination. Object finally shot away
Delta Aquarid meteor shower (mean date).
Black sphere and satellite lights seen, two approached motorboat, one surrounded by "fog." Paralysis felt, missing time, physiological effects
UFO brightly illuminated car, witness badly frightened, memory loss. Fired pistol at object circling the car, fled at high speed. Red dots like puncture marks found on wrists
Triangular objects with body lights, humming sound, observed three times over freeway and valley area
Local concentration of sightings
Daylight disc photo
Localized concentration began, continuing off and on for several years. Many structured object cases, photographs (see January—February 1984).
Domed disc hovered nearby, beamed light down onto truck. Driver fled, object followed and beamed light on truck a second time before departing
UFO swooped over vehicle, blocked road
E-M effects on car, dome-shaped object overhead, driver blacked out, taken to hospital with memory loss, physiological effects

A worldwide nuclear war game was directed from the White House (source: House Committee on Foreign Affairs, Subcommittee on International Security & Scientific Affairs hearing, April 2, 1982. Rep. Larry Winn, Jr. ER-Kans.] presiding).
Diamond-shaped object with body lights, bright "headlights," flew overhead, seen clearly in police spotlight. Abnormal silence
Wedge-shaped object with body lights hovered low over reservoir, lights reflecting in water. Instant relocation, red light beam shone on house, then on car
Shiny disc below two military aircraft darted up to their altitude, rapidly circled one of them, sped out of sight
Leonid meteor shower (mean date).
Circular object with body lights shone light beam down into field, three humanoid silhouettes visible inside. Object rose, flew directly over car, humming sound
Luminous object brightly illuminated police car, changed direction when pursued. Domed disc shape seen to east, light beam toward ground, descended behind tree line
"Night Siege" boomerangs, continuing for a long period of time
Wing or V-shaped UFO hovered, emitted light beam downward
Luminous object landed, E-M effects, animal reaction. UFO rose from field illuminating area, body lights visible, accelerated rapidly out of sight, physical traces
Silvery disc passed over car, right wheels lifted off road, car lights blinked off and on. Car dropped hard back onto road, engine stalled. Severe physiological effects
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Numerous sightings, radar trackings, photographs by scientific field team with instruments
Disc-shaped object hovered ahead of car. Second object paced alongside car, bright illumination of area
Leonid meteor shower (mean date).
Silent, triangular object with body lights
Silent triangular object
Whitley Strieber alien encounter
Quadrantid meteor shower (mean date).
UFO emitted six light beams toward ground. About n minutes later in Pittsburgh, silver-gray disc with body lights hovered, mist formed around it. Object tilted, moved out of sight
Hovering oval object, body lights, brightly illuminated the area, moved up, down, and sideways. Dog agitated during sighting
Concentration of sightings including many physiological effects cases and traumatic effects
Cessna pilot and wife saw dome-shaped object make head-on pass at plane

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: Sao Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Radar-visual and pilot sightings, military jet interceptors scrambled in pursuit
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
9:50-10:10 P.M. Lighted object seen over wide area moving SW to NE was Japanese satellite.
UFO landed, witness had two-hour memory loss, strong physical traces at site. Memory later returned of two humanoid beings, views inside a craft
Orionid meteor shower (mean date).
Blue-green oval ahead of car, forward motion impeded
Leonid meteor shower (mean date).
Japan Airlines freighter aircraft encountered lighted maneuvering objects. bright illumination, heat, radar-visual, E-M effects, satellite objects
Flurry of sightings including cigar-shaped objects, a radar tracking, and other features
Motorists encountered hovering large oval object, lights around perimeter, terrain brightly illuminated

UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.location: Airliner en route from Toronto to Winnipeg, Canada
UFOEvidenceHall Timeline.desc: Huge unidentified target on weather radar for four minutes
Shiny oval, hovered; brightened, took off like a shot, left white trail. Stopped abruptly, maneuvered, lights flashed, shot straight up out of sight
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Ellipse with windows beamed light down on children in playground, two humanoids visible in object
Sighting concentration, including 60 reports to sheriff's office in Little River County.
Flurry of sightings including oval objects with flashing body lights.
First five photos reported taken by builder Ed Walters
About 8:50 P.M. (CST). Soviet rocket casing orbital decay and atmospheric re-entry, multiple fiery objects from NW to SE.
Geminid meteor shower (mean date).
Elliptical object landed ahead of car, blocked road. Headlights and engine failed, blinding light from underside. Car dragged toward object
Glowing red object followed car, moved up and down as if following contours of local terrain
Knowles family encounter with oval object that buzzed car, car lifted off road, physical traces
Pilot saw hovering object, intense lights like searchlights in a triangle. Climbed vertically out of sight
Coast Guard witnesses, large illuminated ellipse hovering over Lake Erie, landing on ice. Smaller triangular objects emerged, zipped around independently
John Salter, Jr., and John, III, abduction
Motorists saw bright light ahead, engine lost power, radio failed. Four square yellow lights and light beam visible. Car returned to normal after lights disappeared (Basterfield, 1997a).
Silvery oval object hovered, brilliant illumination, physiological effects. UFO maneuvered erratically, emitted silvery white trail when flew away
Local concentration of sightings.
Witness aimed rifle at hovering disc, brilliant white light on underside, humming sound. Light beam engulfed him, rifle misfired, object sped away
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).
Several abduction cases. (Vallee, 1992).
Videorecorder film taken of a white, Saturn-shaped object with squarish ring that changed direction, rose at a steep angle at high speed
Private pilot saw shiny oval object making quick starts and stops
Videotape taken of hovering object that rotated, split in two, then faded or "dissolved."
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Luminous mushroom-shaped object hovered over field, two smaller objects with red lights emerged, operated independently, departed at high speed
UFO sighting concentration in vicinity. Four landings and three different kinds of entities reported. Geodesic engineer saw maneuvering airship-like object September 24
Concentration of triangular UFO sightings, jet interceptor chases, radar-visual sightings (see November 29, 1989, March 30, 1990).
Double abduction case investigated by John Carpenter
Police patrol car illuminated by brilliant light beam, hovering dark triangular object, humming noise, alternately moved and hovered
Linda Cortile's (pseudonym) abduction from 12th floor apartment, allegedly witnessed by international figure and security guards (Hopkins, 1996). 1990
Dark round or oblong object with red body light photographed by several people
Silvery object with two rows of lights paced just ahead of car for two to three miles. Engine, lights failed until object departed
Fireball meteor observed about 6:15 A.M. arcing from northwest to southeast.
Long-lasting fireball meteor, blue-green with short tail, changing to white and orange as it broke up, observed about 7:10 P.M. moving northeast.
Prominent fireball meteor changing color from white to green to orange observed about 7:50 P.M.
Brilliant white pulsating oval paced truck, hovered over road, instant relocation over truck, cast light beam down
Sphere with windows seen from boat near lighthouse. Several objects took off at high speed with loud booms, stopped, hovered, flashed bright white lights
Jet interceptor scrambled to identify radar target, saw two flashing white lights, locked radar gunsight on object
Blindingly bright oval object approached car, passed low overhead. Driver fled, looked back, saw object hovering over a field
Gendarmes reported luminous, high speed objects. Jet interceptors scrambled, multiple radar tracks of fast-moving objects
Dark, delta-shaped object with large white lights around edge hovered. Departed at high speed
Formations of white objects with red and green body lights alternately hovered and darted around. Unidentified objects also tracked on radar
U.S. Air flight crew saw a rectangular, light-reflective object that flew into clouds
(Maine to West Virginia). 2:50 to 3:00 A.M. Fireball meteor, green and red sparks, moving east or north.
7:58 A.M. Glowing bluegreen cigar-shaped object crossed path of airliner
Alitalia Airlines plane on final approach saw round object cross its path, confirmed by radar
Lyrid meteor shower (mean date).
Pilots encountered and radar tracked reddish oval object that paced a small aircraft and hovered above airport, E-M effects on plane
American tourist took photo of church, unexplained image showed up in picture when developed
12:15 A.M. Bright green fireball meteor, wavered, split up, bright illumination, sonic boom.
Glowing green dome-shaped object maneuvered around patrol car, E-M effects, officer badly frightened
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Triangular silvery object passed over car, blue flashing body lights. Made sharp turns, moved out of sight
Manta ray—shaped object with body lights approached car, falling leaf motions, hovered, light beam brightly illuminated terrain
About 7:50 P.M. Greenorange fireball meteor southwest to northeast on flat trajectory for about 17 seconds, broke up over southeastern New York. Large meteorite fell in Peekskill, NY.
Numerous sightings in Saguache County
Airliner crew saw dark blue, metallicappearing triangular object
Numerous sightings, photographs reportedly taken
Round UFO with satellite objects
Cigar-shaped object with red body lights maneuvered at low level
Round UFO with satellite objects
Five people in two separate cars encountered UFO on road, experienced missing time. Memories returned gradually without hypnosis, including tall beings who abducted them (Chalker, 1996).
Perseid meteor shower (mean date).
Luminous UFO maneuvered erratically near airliner
Air France airliner—UFO encounter, tracked on military radar
Cigar-shaped object illuminated car with light beam, E-M effects
Vehicle encounter with glowing oblong object, E-M effects

Motorists encountered glowing orange oblong objects, one followed car. Diamond-shaped object hovered overhead when they stopped to look. Missing time period discovered upon arrival home (Basterfield, 1997b).
Green- and red-lighted object with satellite objects
America West airline crew observed cigar-shaped object with pulsating lights
